Gong Shiyi Qianhu Ci Zi Zeng Sikong Shi Da Jiangzheng Hao Daguang Zhi Daxingshansi Sanzang Shamen Bukong Respectfully Translated by Imperial Decree, Disciple Shangdu Caowai Yang Jingfeng Xiu Zhu Heshang Translated this version in the second year of Ganyuan.
Duanzhou Sima Shi Yao.
Held and compiled it, but was unable to categorize it.
Causing the text and meaning to be cumbersome.
Fearing that learners would find it difficult to use.
Thereupon, the disciple Yang Jingfeng of Caowai.
Personally received the instructions of the Venerable Master.
Further revised and annotated it.
Edited and proofread it for copying and practice.
All the disciples each held a copy.
At that time, it was the year Xuanhui, the second year of the Tang Dynasty's Guangde era.
1. Introduction: Determining the Proper Time for the Stars and Constellations, Chapter 1 of the Sutra on the Calendar of the Stars and Constellations When heaven and earth were first established,
The essence of cold and heat transformed into the sun and moon.
The sun and moon opposing each other gave birth to myriad things.
Dividing the constellations and setting up palaces governs the myriad things.
The sun governs the yang position.
Following the stars and constellations in a clockwise direction,
It takes the thirteen constellations of Zhang, Yi, Zhen, Jiao, Kang, Di, Fang, Xin, Wei, Ji, Dou, Niu, and NÃ¼.
Until half of the constellation Xu,
It just corresponds to the center of the child earth.
It is divided into six palaces.
But the sun and moon, the celestial rulers,
Both take the five stars as their ministers and aides. The sun's light is flaming and fierce,
Causing things to respond to each other.
It takes the yang beast lion as the palace deity.
The moon's light is clear and cool,
Causing things to respond to each other.
It takes the yin insect crab as the palace deity.
Moreover, the sun's nature is rigid and righteous,
While the moon's nature is gentle and wise.
Righteousness benefits those below, while wisdom extends to the ministers.
And the sun and moon each bestowed their own palaces.
The five stars are swift to arrive and slow.
They are the stars of the Dipper, Venus, Mars, Jupiter, and Saturn.
Arranged in order.
The slow and fast movements are shown here.
The twelve palaces are the stations of the seven luminaries.
Each one shows good and bad fortune, and the calamities and anomalies of the times.
Moreover, each palace has a divine form.
To show the image of the palace.
Moreover, one palace is assigned to the twenty-eight lunar mansions and the nine continents.
And all kinds of creatures are affected by it.
The moon is fifty yojanas wide.
It is connected to life and determines good and bad fortune.
The great body belongs to the sun and moon.

The sun palace is 51 yojanas wide and is made of fire essence. Taiyang is 10 yojanas wide and is made of empty essence. Suixing is 9 yojanas wide and is made of moon essence. Chenxing is 8 yojanas wide and is made of fire essence. Yinghuo is 7 yojanas wide and is made of sun essence. Tuxing is 6 yojanas wide. The smaller stars are 1 krosha wide. The sun palace is made of crystal, the substance of fire essence.
It is warm and comfortable and can illuminate a hundred things.
The moon palace is made of lapis lazuli.
It is clear and cool and can illuminate myriad things.
The sun, moon, and stars.
Beings are placed in the sky by karma.
They ride on the wind and stop.
They are halfway up Mount Sumeru, above Yugandhara.
They revolve around the twenty-seven constellations and twelve palaces.
The divisions of the palaces and constellations are now explained in full.
They are also made into diagrams.
The first star has four feet.
Zhang has four feet.
Yixing has one foot.
The position of the great sun is there.
Its spirit is like a lion.
Therefore, it is called the Lion's Den.
It presides over matters of promotion and wealth.
If a person is born under this palace,
According to the law, they will have sufficient spirit, wealth and nobility, and be filial.
They are suitable to hold the position of commanding troops.
The second wing has three feet.
The Dipper has four feet.
The Horn has two feet.
The position of Mars is here.
Its spirit is like a woman.
Therefore, it is called the Woman's Palace.
It presides over matters of wives and concubines.
If a person is born under this palace,
According to the law, they will find it difficult to make close friends, have many children, sufficient wealth, and high rank. They are suitable to hold the position of managing the palace and rooms.
The third Horn has two feet.
The Neck has four feet.
The Base has three feet.
The position of Venus is here.
Its spirit is like a scale.
Therefore, it is called the Scale Palace.
It presides over matters of treasure and storehouses.
If a person is born under this palace,
According to the law, they will have an upright mind, fair governance, faith, and much wealth.
They are suitable to hold the position of managing storehouses.
The fourth Base has one foot.
The house has four feet.
The heart has four feet.
The position of Mars is there.
Its spirit is like a scorpion.
Therefore, it is called the Scorpion Palace.
It governs matters of many illnesses, prohibitions, and division of the body.
If a person is born under this palace,
according to the Dharma, they will have many illnesses, a thin appearance, an evil mind, and jealousy.
They are suitable for the position of a sick person.
The fifth has four feet at the end.
The house has four feet.
The dipper has one foot.
The position of Jupiter is there.
Its spirit is like a bow.
Therefore, it is called the Bow Palace.
It governs matters of joy, celebration, and gaining wealth.
If a person is born under this palace,
according to the Dharma, they will have many strategies and a scheming mind.
They are suitable for the position of a general or minister.
The sixth has three feet in the dipper.
The woman has four feet.
The void has two feet.
The position of Saturn is there.
Its spirit is like a makara.
Therefore, it is called the Makara Palace.
It governs matters of fighting and disputes.
If a person is born under this palace,
In the Dharma, the mind is coarse, committing the five heinous crimes, and not respecting wife and children.
Joining palms, the duty of punishing and killing.
To the right, the above six positions are all under the division of the sun.
Below, the six positions are all under the division of the great yin.

If a person is born under this palace,

If a person is born under this palace,

He has learning, nobility, wealth, and loyalty.
Joining palms, the duty of a civil or military official.
The ninth Lou has four feet.
The stomach has four feet.
The Pleiades have one foot.
The position of Mars is here.
Its spirit is like a sheep.
Therefore, it is called the Sheep Palace.
It governs matters of illustrious conduct.
If a person is born under this palace,
it accords with having much merit and longevity.
And also being able to endure humiliation.
It is suitable for the role of chef with palms joined.
The tenth Pleiades has three feet.
The seven stars of the nectarious one have four feet.
The three stars of the mouth have two feet.
The position of Jupiter is here.
Its spirit is like an ox.
Therefore, it is called the Ox Palace.
It governs the affairs of four-legged livestock and herding.
If a person is born under this palace,
it accords with having merit, many close friends,
long life, and being respected by the nobility.
It is suitable for the role of horse stable with palms joined.
The eleventh three stars of the mouth have two feet.
The four stars of the heart have four feet.
The three stars of the well have three feet.
The position of Saturn is here.
Its spirit is like a married couple.
Therefore, it is called the Palace of Lust.
It governs the affairs of pregnancy and descendants.
If a person is born under this palace,
they will have many wives and concubines in accordance with the Dharma and be loved and respected by others.
They will be appointed to the position of holding the keys.
The twelfth house is one foot of the well,
four feet of the ghost,
and four feet of the willow.
It is the position of the moon.
Its spirit is like a crab.
Therefore, it is called the crab palace.
It governs official matters and disputes.
If a person is born under this palace,
they will have a bad temper and be deceitful in accordance with the Dharma, but be intelligent and short-lived.
They will be appointed to the position of handling criminal cases and lawsuits.
In ancient times, the second month of the white Boksha was the beginning of spring.
At that time, the luminary was in the lunar mansion Lou.
The Way was equal, the scenery was correct, the sun was at noon, and the qi was harmonious.
All things gradually flourished and everything increased.

Brahma Heaven was delighted and ordered it to be the beginning of the year. The scenery wind is called the Great Tang. The Tang Dynasty takes the beginning of the tiger as the beginning of the year.ğŸ”½India takes the beginning of the rabbit as the beginning of the year.
Then, the Tang Dynasty's months are all the second, third, fourth, up to the twelfth month.
Then, in India, they all take the night of the fifteenth day of the bright moon when the moon is in a certain lunar mansion,

and call it the name of the month. Therefore, they call the month when the moon is in the lunar mansion Jiao Mao the Jiao Mao month.ğŸ”½They call the month when the moon is in the lunar mansion Di the Di month.
Then they only call it the month of Jiao Mao, Di, Xin, and Ji,
and do not discuss the second, third, and fourth months of Jiao Mao, Di, and Chen.
This is the difference between the East and the West.

Learners should first understand it. Now, there are two detailed explanations on the left.ğŸ”½The Jiao month, Jing Feng, is the second month of the Tang Dynasty, when the Dipper is in the position of Jiao Mao. The Di month, Jing Feng, is the third month of the Tang Dynasty, when the Dipper is in the position of Chen.ğŸ”½The Xin month, Jing Feng, is the fourth month of the Tang Dynasty, when the Dipper is in the position of Si. The Ji month, Jing Feng, is the fifth month of the Tang Dynasty, when the Dipper is in the position of Wu.

The Nu month, Jing Feng, is the sixth month of the Tang Dynasty, when the Dipper is in the position of Wei. The Shi month, Jing Feng, is the seventh month of the Tang Dynasty, when the Dipper is in the position of Shen.

The Mao month's Jingfeng is the ninth month of the Tang calendar, when the Dipper is in the Xu position.ğŸ”½The Zhi month's Jingfeng is the tenth month of the Tang calendar, when the Dipper is in the Hai position.
The Gui month's Jingfeng is the eleventh month of the Tang calendar, when the Dipper is in the Zi position.

The Xing month's Jingfeng is the twelfth month of the Tang calendar, when the Dipper is in the Chou position. The Wing month's Jingfeng is the first month of the Tang calendar, when the Dipper is in the Yin position. The new performance is on the left.
Jingfeng said: Translated from the Sanskrit original for the first time.
The scholars say it is hidden and secret.
The Tang people are confused.
They do not understand the reason.
If one does not practice for a long time, it will be difficult to achieve.
Now I request to perform the old as new.
Taking the monthly and daily records, I list them to form a new one. The new one is called the Great Tang Monthly Dipper Twelve Positions Chart.
It is supplemented with the names of the palaces.
And arrange them according to the sequence of the lunar stations.
Then, it will be clear and the meaning and principles will not be hidden. I hope the great talents of the present generation will understand this intention.

The immortal asked,
The celestial way has twenty-seven constellations, some broad and some narrow.
They are all divided by four-legged equal parts.
The moon moves either in front or behind.
Examining the differences in Tianye's explanations, they do not match.
How can the suitability of the direct constellations be determined?
The Bodhisattva said,
There are three kinds of lunar constellations in general:
1. Preceding conjunction, 2. Following conjunction, 3. Parallel conjunction.
Knowing these three, the direct constellations can be known.
What is meant by preceding conjunction?
The six constellations Kui, Lou, Wei, Mao, Pi, and Zui are the preceding conjunction.
What is meant by parallel conjunction?
The twelve constellations San, Jing, Gui, Liu, Xing, Zhang, Yi, Zhen, Jiao, Kang, Di, and Fang are the parallel conjunction.
What is meant by following conjunction?
The nine stars of Heart, Tail, Dipper, Woman, Void, Danger, Room, Wall, and Assembly form a following conjunction.
If a star is in front of the moon and the moon is behind the star, it is a front conjunction.
If the moon is in front of the star and the star is behind the moon,
it is like a calf following its mother, forming a following conjunction.
If the stars and the moon are side by side, it is a parallel conjunction. Jing Feng said: The method of celestial phenomena,
the west is the front and the east is the back.
If the moon is in the east of the star and the star is in the west of the moon, then the star is in front of the moon and the moon is behind the star.
The others all follow this.
The verse says:
The six stars before the name are a front conjunction, the twelve stars are a left and right conjunction with the moon.
The nine stars are like a calf following its mother, and the Kui star should be known as straight.

Preface to the Chapter on the Secret Lunar Mansions of the Three Nines, the Lunar Mansions, and the Yasha Calendar Preface to the Chapter on the Secret Lunar Mansions of the Three Nines, the Third of the Nine Methods: Life Lunar Mansion, Glory Lunar Mansion, Decline Lunar Mansion, Peace Lunar Mansion, Danger Lunar Mansion, Accomplishment Lunar Mansion, Destruction Lunar Mansion, Friend Lunar Mansion, Kinsman Lunar Mansion. The Methods of the Two Nines: Karma Lunar Mansion, Glory Lunar Mansion, Decline Lunar Mansion, Peace Lunar Mansion, Danger Lunar Mansion, Accomplishment Lunar Mansion, Destruction Lunar Mansion, Friend Lunar Mansion, Kinsman Lunar Mansion. The Methods of the Three Nines: Womb Lunar Mansion, Glory Lunar Mansion, Decline Lunar Mansion, Peace Lunar Mansion, Danger Lunar Mansion, Accomplishment Lunar Mansion, Destruction Lunar Mansion, Friend Lunar Mansion, Kinsman Lunar Mansion. This method determines the lunar mansion of the day of a person's birth.
It becomes the direct lunar mansion.
The life lunar mansion becomes the first.
Next, the glory lunar mansion, then the decline lunar mansion,
and the peace lunar mansion, danger lunar mansion, accomplishment lunar mansion, destruction lunar mansion, friend lunar mansion, and kinsman lunar mansion.
Thus, the nine lunar mansions form the method of the nine nines.
Next, the karma lunar mansion is taken as the head.
The following nine are the same as before, forming the method of the two nines.
Next, the lunar mansions are taken as the head.
The following nine are in accordance with the method of the previous three nines, and they cover the twenty-seven lunar mansions. For example, if someone is born on the fifth day of the second month,
that person belongs to the Pleiades.
Take the Pleiades as the first life.ğŸ”½Next, the mouth lunar mansion is the prosperous lunar mansion.
The asterism is the declining lunar mansion.
The well is the peaceful lunar mansion.
The ghost is the perilous lunar mansion.
The willow is the fulfilled lunar mansion.
The star is the ruined lunar mansion.ğŸ”½The wing is the friendly lunar mansion.
The tail is the intimate lunar mansion.
The horn is the prosperous lunar mansion. The ridge is the declining lunar mansion.
They are all the same as the female womb lunar mansion.
The void is the prosperous lunar mansion.
The following is in accordance with the previous, which is the method of the three nines.
The others are all in accordance with this.
The preceptor said: Whenever one first makes friends with someone,ğŸ”½one must first look at the person's life lunar mansion to see which lunar mansion it presses on me.

Chapter 4: The Calendar of the Seven Luminaries and the Auspicious Days of the Lunar Mansions. The seven luminaries are the sun, moon, and five planets.
Their essence shines above in the heavens, and their spirits descend to interact with humans.
They are responsible for good and evil, and preside over good and bad fortune.
They move once a day, changing every seven days, completing a cycle and starting over.
The spirits interact with good and evil, and the words are fully explained. Jing Feng said: The method of seeking the auspicious days of the seven luminaries
is now fully contained in the eighth calendrical algorithm at the end of this sutra scroll.
It is complete.
The sun is the essence of the sun.
Auspicious day.
Suitable for undertaking missions, taking office, observing troops, practicing warfare,
reciting mantras, practicing medicine,

releasing livestock, traveling far, creating blessings, setting up feasts, praying to the gods, compounding medicine, storing grain in the granary, entering school, discussing official matters, all auspicious.

facing an array, not to be the first to rise.

they will have feet suitable for the Dharma, wisdom, diligence, an upright appearance, a beautiful face, filial piety, and a short life.

then in that year, all things will be abundant and ripe.
If there is an eclipse or an earthquake,
then all things will not be real, and the sun will not be a calamity for a thousand days.
The essence of the moon is the great yin of the sun.

making furniture, setting up beds,

If this planet is obtained on the fifth day of the fifth month,

When people go out, they should not face the seven luminaries.
If they face the sun, they will encounter great misfortune.
If they face the moon, many relatives will be hurt.
If they face Saturn, there will surely be the misfortune of death. If they face Venus, calamities and good fortune will come together.
Then, a verse is spoken:
Sun.
Fire. Moon. Jian. Virtue.
Noble. Relatives. Year.
The back of the town will die, and the gold will be combined and arrive.

Secret Miscellaneous Divination Section Chapter 5: The Secret Miscellaneous Divination Section of the Sutra of the Lunar Mansions and Celestial Luminaries. In general, the seven luminaries move through the heavens.
If they violate the lunar mansions of the six palaces of a person,
there will surely be calamities and misfortunes.
First, the life lunar mansion;
second, the affairs lunar mansion;
third, the intention lunar mansion;
fourth, the gathering lunar mansion;
fifth, the same lunar mansion;
sixth, the conquering lunar mansion.
Counting from the life lunar mansion to the tenth, it becomes the affairs lunar mansion;
the fourth becomes the intention lunar mansion;
the sixteenth becomes the gathering lunar mansion;
the twentieth becomes the same lunar mansion;
the thirteenth becomes the conquering lunar mansion. Jing Feng said, If someone belongs to the lunar mansion of Lu,
counting forward to the fourth, they obtain Pi as the intention lunar mansion. The tenth obtains Xing, which then becomes the affairs lunar mansion.
The thirteenth obtains Zhen, which then becomes the conquering lunar mansion. All of these are obtained by calculation.
If the seven luminaries violate the life lunar mansion,
they will lose money and property and will surely encounter many calamities and misfortunes.
If one offends the matter-dwelling star, one will incur misfortune.
If one offends the intention-dwelling star, one will certainly have much sorrow and suffering.
If one offends the gathering-dwelling star, one will lose wealth and be imprisoned.
If one offends the same-dwelling star, one will be separated and uneasy, with the household declining and wasting away.
If one offends the overcoming star, one will lose wealth, lose official positions, and have one's power and influence diminished.
If the seven luminaries do not offend these six places in total,
then whatever one does will be successful. It is said that all of this must be examined in conjunction with the three nine secret stars in order to determine calamities and misfortunes.
Verse:
Ten matters sought after, firmly not coming; four intentions, worries and troubles.
Sixteen gatherings, losing wealth and misfortune; twenty, same path, mutually opposing.
Thirteen overcoming, power and influence diminished. The seven luminaries not offending these stars,
then a hundred evils will be cleared away.
In general, the sun in its own palace, the third, sixth, and tenth positions are greatly auspicious.
Mars guarding its own star has great calamities and misfortunes.
If the moon is in the native's natal house, the sixth, seventh, or third house, then the results are auspicious.
If Venus is in the third, seventh, or ninth house, it is auspicious.
If the asterism is in the fourth or tenth house, it is also auspicious.
If Jupiter is in the native's natal house, there will be great misfortune.
Whenever people have calamities and misfortunes,
they can uphold the mantra, establish a ritual arena, and use it to avert them. If there are people who cannot remember their natal asterism,
and come to ask me, how should I answer them?
First, one must observe where the person touches when they first come.

Preface to the Sutra on the Calendar of the Constellations and Luminaries, Distinguishing the White and Black Lunar Mansions, Chapter 6: In general, the moon has two parts, the white and the black.
From the first to the fifteenth day is the white lunar mansion.
From the sixteenth to the thirtieth day is the black lunar mansion.ğŸ”½In each month, the first, third, fifth, seventh, tenth, eleventh, and thirteenth days of the white lunar mansion,
and the first, third, fifth, seventh, tenth, eleventh, and thirteenth days of the black lunar mansion,ğŸ”½are all
All that is done will be accomplished, and it is called an auspicious day.
Moreover, on the fourth day of the bright fortnight, it is night.
On the eighth day, it is day.
On the eleventh day, it is night.
On the fifteenth day, it is day.
On the third day of the dark fortnight, it is night.
On the seventh day, it is day.
On the tenth day, it is night.
On the fourteenth day, it is day.

Moreover, on the fourth and eleventh days of the bright fortnight, it is night.
On the eighth and fifteenth days, it is day. On the third and tenth days of the dark fortnight, it is night.
On the seventh and fourteenth days, it is day.

One, three, five, seven, ten, eleven, and thirteen,

Preface to the Sutra on the Good and Evil Aspects of the Days, Named the Calendar of the Lunar Mansions and Luminaries, Preface to the Seventh Chapter on the Good and Evil Aspects of the Days, from the First to the Sixteenth Day, the Wind of the Scene, the First Day,
Is the first day of the bright month.
Sixteen.

Now, fearing that readers will find it difficult to understand,
So I briefly say the words white and black.
Simply cutting the number of days is called the establishment of the name of the day.
Brahma descends.
It is suitable to do good deeds, study the Way, and seek immortals.
and serving teachers and elders are all auspicious, but it is not suitable for long journeys.
In general, the second and seventeenth days are called the days for obtaining wealth.
The day is under the control of the god of creation.

It is suitable for compounding medicine, massage, craftsmanship, going out, making connections, marriage, and increasing fields and houses, all of which are auspicious. In general, the third, eighteenth day is called the day of power, under the control of Narayana.
It is suitable for subduing enemies, eliminating rebels, practicing warfare, raising livestock, instructing subordinates, and farming, which are greatly auspicious.
In general, the fourth, nineteenth day is called the day of fierce martial arts.
It is under the control of Yama.
It is suitable for performing evil deeds, killing, injuring, and subduing rebels, which are auspicious.
Doing good deeds will bring misfortune.
In general, the fifth, twentieth day is called the day of perfection.
The day is under the control of the sun.
It is suitable for performing good deeds, making beds, curtains, vehicles, and clothing.
Farming, building houses, and getting married are all auspicious.
In general, the sixth, twenty-first day is called the day for seeking fame.
It is under the control of the god of youths.
It is suitable for long-lasting and stable matters.
Build houses, palaces,
and establish cities, monasteries, cow and horse stables, etc., all auspicious.
Not suitable for going out.
For seven days, the twenty-second day is called the Friends' Day.
The Northern Dipper is in the sky.
Suitable for making friends, celebrating, stabilizing, and making peace-promoting medicine.
The king's initial wearing of clothes and making of banners, canopies, and tents are all auspicious.
Only not suitable for long journeys.
For eight days, the twenty-third day is called the Great Battle Day, with VÄsudeva below.
Suitable for matters of strength and use, making weapons,
building city walls and digging moats, all auspicious.

For ten days, the twenty-fifth day is called the Good Dharma Day.
The Good Dharma deity is below.
It is suitable for long-term projects and quick and agile activities.
Digging wells and stoves, cultivating the Way,
Building meritorious temples and following the Dharma are all very auspicious.
Generally, the 11th and 26th days are the days of compassion and ferocity.
The heavenly sovereign is below.
It is suitable for newly building houses, constructing city temples, halls, and stables,

Generally, the 12th and 27th days are the days of fame.
The sun is below.
It is suitable for long-term projects to secure the state,

Generally, the 13th and 28th days are the days of supreme victory.

And wearing clothes, flower garlands, gold and jade ornaments, and paintings,
